intro: Hieracium madarodes, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Hieracium madarodes is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions across Europe.
